summary:
A problem solver, passionate and results-oriented software engineering professional with 12+ years of industry experience in fintech(mobile payment), core/internet banking and digital asset management. As a summary:

- 2+ years of experience as tech team leadership
- Great people management skills, mentoring freshers via pair programming, code reviews etc.
- Partner to frontend devs, product team, UX designers etc. (cross functional communication)
- Self-motivated, self-managing professional with strong organizational skills, ready to take responsibility
- Extensive experience in Java 11+ and Java enterprise architectures and tools
- Well versed in Google Cloud Platform(GCP), Kubernetes and Docker containers
- Experienced in taking ownership from design to production (DevOps mindset)
- Solid experience in distributed systems, reactive microservices, DDD and event-driven architecture
- Pragmatic programmer with ability to translate business needs to functional services
- Proactive, having customer focused mindset

certifications.name: Reactive Architecture(1): Introduction to Reactive Systems

profile_positions.description:
With the ambition for success in the software industry, Paya has begun working on an innovative mobile payment platform.

- Helped designing the architecture of platform based on event-driven and reactive microservices best practices utilizing Java 11, Spring Boot/Cloud, Resilience4j, Kafka, Docker etc.
- Designed microservice boundaries by following Event First DDD to draw bounded contexts and extract domain models
- Implemented fault tolerant services using Resilience4j components (Retry, Circuit Breaker)
- Implemented log aggregation by using Logback TcpSocketAppender and Elastic Stack
- Added metrics monitoring by utilizing Spring Actuator, Micrometer, Prometheus and Grafana
- Added distributed tracing utilizing Spring Cloud Sleuth and Zipkin console, added trace/span IDs to aggregated logs making them traceable in Kibana
- Implemented a separate microservice for platform integration with all third-party services, making it discoverable by other microservices. Here I also created an Anti Corruption Layer(ACL) by isolating probable errors and returning cached data wherever possible
- Implemented unit/integration tests using JUnit, Spring Testing and Mockito

Technologies:
Java 11, Spring Boot/Cloud/Security, Resilience4j, Spring Data, JPA, JUnit, Mockito, Spring Test, Swagger, Actuator,  Micrometer, Prometheus, Grafana, Spring Boot Admin, Log4j, Logback, Elastic Stack(ELK), Spring Cloud Sleuth, Zipkin, MySQL, Redis, Maven, Docker, Docker-Compose, Git, Linux
profile_positions.title: Senior Java Backend Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Vosouq Financial Services is a startup subsidiary of Bank Mellat IT Holding. The platform is a mobile payment App. My responsibilities:

1- Tech Leader
- Led a cross functional team of backend, mobile and machine learning engineers
- Managed to be in charge of my team, being alert about every individual, supporting them if needed
- Followed my developers’ progress, paving the way for them till reaching our sprint goals
- Was the facilitator between the product Dept and tech team

2- Scrum Master
- Was the scrum master of team, following agile/scrum development practices
- Collected our product backlog while negotiating with product manager, prioritizing tasks, defining milestones, release plans and sprints

3- Software Architect/Backend Engineer
- Designed the backend architecture of platform based on microservices architecture
- Implemented our authentication and authorization mechanism using Spring Security
- Implemented a set of loosely coupled microservices by incorporating patterns like CQRS, Event Sourcing and choreography(Kafka as event bus and MongoDB as event store )
- Implemented infrastructural needs (log aggregation, metric monitoring, API documentation etc.) 
- Defined our backend Git Flow by specifying develop/uat/stage/release branches and configured our CI/CD pipelines utilizing GitLab CI/CD and GitLab Runner
- Replaced Hibernate Envers by gRPC and immudb to improve immutable audit logs implementation(by 5x)
- Implemented an E-KYC microservice for face recognition, liveness detection and anti spoofing utilizing Python, Flask, OpenCV, TensorFlow, PyTorch, FaceNet etc.

Technologies:
Java 11, Python, Flask, Spring Boot/Cloud Netflix/Security, JWT, Spring Boot Admin/Config/Actuator, Log4j, Logback, Elastic Stack, Micrometer, Prometheus, Grafana, Swagger, Kafka, Redis, MongoDB, JPA/Hibernate, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Hibernate Envers, gRPC, immudb, Maven, Git, GitLab CI/CD, GitLab Runner, Docker, Swarm, Compose, Apache JMeter, Ubuntu Server
profile_positions.title: Technical Team Leader

profile_positions.description:
Phonepay is the largest wallet/mobile payment platform for taxi transportation industry and one of the first ‘payment by QR Code scanning’ applications in Iran.

- Developed several microservices including loyalty, customer club, third-party integration, top-up, etc.
- Utilized Java 8, Spring Boot and Spring Cloud Netflix as main tech stack for our microservices, implementing REST APIs and message/event driven services
- Participated in architectural decisions to implement scalable, HA, clean and maintainable microservices
- Part of a development team with agile culture and scrum methodology with two-week sprints
- Enhanced performance (up to 8x) of our heavy-load messaging microservice by incorporating parallel and async programming techniques (Executor Service, Completable Futures, Spring Async)
- Resolved a brute force security issue by adding Rate Limiting mechanism to our registration flow
- Implemented a push back mechanism using WebSocket and MQTT protocol in order to informing our in-browser widget for 3rd party payments
- Implemented a P2P payment(cash transfer) solution based on users' wallets
- Implemented a B2C messaging microservice to support app notification infrastructure
- Designed non-relational data models for our loyalty and club microservices

Technologies: 
Java 8, Spring Boot, Spring Cloud Netflix, Spring Security, OAuth 2, Spring Data JPA/MongoDB, jOOQ, Flyway, Kafka, etcd, EMQ broker, Redis, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Tomcat, Jetty, Gradle, Git, GitLab CI/CD, Ansible and Docker, Linux(Ubuntu, CentOS)
profile_positions.title: Senior Java Backend Developer

profile_positions.description:
Nilin is provider for the mobile bank application of IranZamin Bank of Iran. The company also is contractor for the first wallet/mobile payment application based on QR Code scanning in Iran (Jibit Product)

- Developed services on a microservices based architecture utilizing Spring Cloud Netflix OSS
- Configured and replaced HashiCorp Consul(instead of Eureka) as service registry/discovery solution
- Implemented a service to register 3rd Party services in Consul, making service discovery seamless
- Implemented an automated batch processing microservice to solve some batch problems nightly utilizing Spring Batch and Spring Scheduling Timer
- Developed a cheque management microservice for mobile banking application
- Installed a Jira instance and configured customized workflows for tracking tasks and issues

Technologies:
Java 8, Spring (Boot, Cloud Netflix OSS, Data JPA, Batch, Security), HashiCorp Consul, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Maven, Git, Tomcat, Linux (CentOS, Ubuntu)
profile_positions.title: Senior Java Backend Developer

profile_positions.description:
Navaco company is Software/Hardware provider for Maskan Bank of Iran. 

- Developed subsystems of Loan/Facilities services of bank’s core platform
- Worked on frontend/backend sides of services utilizing Java, Spring MVC, JPA, EclipseLink, jQuery, PL/SQL ...
- Worked Collaboratively with our architects as well as product designers to decide on more elaborate designs
- Helped our BI developers in writing correct queries on designed data models
- Migrated a legacy code implemented by Delphi language to our new Spring services
- Enhanced a poorly implemented service by rewriting parts of the service, removing unnecessary DB fetches, revising DB queries and adding EclipseLink caching

Technologies: 
Java, Spring MVC, JPA 2.0, EclipseLink, Oracle PL/SQL, jQuery, HTML, CSS, Maven, SVN, Tomcat, Nginx
profile_positions.title: Senior Java Developer

profile_positions.description:
Rayan EN is the IT Dept of Eghtesad Novin Bank, Iran’s first private bank. The company is in charge of all software needs of the bank. This project is a replacement for the bank’s old core banking software.

- Software designer and developer of core banking system of Eghtesad Novin Bank of Iran.
- Designed and developed a customized workflow engine with conformance to bpmn 2.0 as an in-house technology to serve bank processes.

The ideas behind our workflow engine was completely innovative and new among all workflow engine technologies. In fact its functionality was divided to two step operation. The first step did compile the designed bpmn files to java code(it was offline part) and the second step was responsible for interpreting and executing those processes(it was online engine).

- Participated in design sessions for offline compiler of processes(we used JAXP and JAXB for parsing and compiling bpmn files).
- Designed and developed the online engine responsible for loading, executing and managing compiled processes.
- Collaborated with team architects for smoothly integrating our online engine within core banking infrastructure.
- Participated in planning and refinement sessions with product owner, offering and receiving feedback on the last completed iterate.
- Collaborated with quality assurance team for verification of designs/implementations in order to identifying defects ASAP.

Technologies: 
Java, JSF 2/PrimeFaces, jQuery, CDI, EJB 3, JPA 2, Glassfish 3.1, Maven, JBoss Arquillian, Junit, eclipse bpmn2 modeler, IBM Rational Software Architect(RSA), IBM Jazz Administration
profile_positions.title: Java Developer and Software Designer

profile_positions.description:
Behestan Rayan is a banking software provider, mostly for small/medium banks and financial institutions. The company is in charge of providing a total solution for software needs of financial institutions including core banking, mobile and internet banking, POS devices/middleware/software, internet payment gateway etc.

- Full-stack developer of internet banking product
- Responsible for delivering releases to bank data centers
- Led quality assurance team members conducting UAT testing and release reviewing
- Used Java Keytool for generating public/private key pairs and deployed signed certificates on JBoss AS
- Improved the execution time of some poorly implemented stored procedures with PL/SQL
- Implemented a reporting service for Gift/Credit Card service
- Responsible for following releases, communicating with customers and gathering their feedbacks

Technologies: 
Java, JSF/Richfaces, JBoss Seam, Oracle PL/SQL, Ant, SVN, JBoss AS 7, RHEL
profile_positions.title: Java Web Developer

profile_positions.description:
Douran group is one of the largest and first providers of Iran ISPs. Our subsidiary was automation system provider for governmental organizations.
 
- Designer and developer of a large scale and workflow based automation system utilizing JBoss jBPM and Drools.
- Helped our tech leader developing architectural features of system.
- Participated in code review sessions.
- Refined our archive management module using JCR/JackRabbit.
- Responsible for moderating our local Maven repository(Artifactory) and our Subversion server.
- Developed mission management subsystem.
- Configured Tomcat as runtime engine of Microsoft IIS using ISAPI redirector.

Used Spring MVC, EJB 3.0, JPA 2.0, JUnit, jBPM 5/Drools, JCR/Jackrabbit, MS SQL Server, Maven, svn, HTML, CSS, jQuery, Apache Tiles, GlassFish, Ubuntu.
profile_positions.title: Java Developer and Software Designer

profile_positions.description:
- Designer and developer of a web based automation system.
- Developed a simple pull-based chat module.
- Modified iText library for customizing its right-to-left PDF exporting functionality.
- Used JavaMail API and Apache James Mail Server along with JAXP for developing communication protocol with other automation systems.

Used Java, GWT, iText, JavaMail API, Apache JAMES Mail Server, MySQL, Ant, svn, Tomcat, Visual Paradigm.
profile_positions.title: Java Developer

profile_positions.description:
Kalamehr is a wholesale import/export enterprise which plays a crucial role in market. My responsibilities were mainly divided into administering IT requirements of the company as well as developing, maintaining and extending company's e-commerce website. I was personally responsible and sole developer of the full life cycle of our website.
 
- I gathered and analysed requirements, designed, developed and maintained the website
- Developed features like customer/order management, site usage statistics and latest news management

Technologies:
HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSP/Servlet, MySQL, Tomcat, cPanel.
profile_positions.title: Website Developer and IT Administrator

skills: Spring Boot, Cloud, Data, MVC, Security, Batch
